item.title: Sirius and Canopus
item.summary: |han≠kass'o's step-grandmother (Ttuai-an) joyfully adressed Canopus and Sirius when there was enough food to eat.
item.comments: 1) p.8467v: |han≠kass'o observed this himself, 2) p.8468v: what the people say when food is abundant, 3) This story is found in Book VIII-28
item.author: |han≠kass'o (Klein Jantje) (VIII)

keyword.subkw: rejoicing before them celebration of food
and !xu, or the abundance of food
|han≠kass'o's step-grandmother, Ttuai-an, calls out to them
rejoicing before the stars when it is abundant
his step-grandmother, Ttuai-an, calls out to the stars
when food is abundant it is !xu
joyful, to rejoice in an abundance of food
|han≠kass'o's step-grandmother, Ttuai-an, calls out to the stars
|han≠kass'o's step-grandmother, Ttuai-an, calls out to the stars
an address to Sirius and Canopus
